com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util.Log

  • public final class Log
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class serves as a complete logging system.

    Applications can log messages through this system which will be timestamped and written to a text file during runtime.

    Author:
    Ryan Palmer

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Log.InternalLogEntry
      Subclass of LogRecord which is passed to the internal logger, adding some additional features such as a caller object, timestamp, and thread name.
      private static class  Log.InternalLogger
      The internal logger class definition
      private static class  Log.LogService
      This service will run on a dedicated thread, reading buffered log entries from the queue and writing them to the log file.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Start reading from the queue and writing entries to the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while constructing the file writer.

      • stop

        public static void stop()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Stop reading from the queue and writing entries to the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while closing the file writer.

      • checkLogBufferAndWriteNewEntries

        private static void checkLogBufferAndWriteNewEntries()
        Read all currently queued log entries until the queue is empty, and write them to the log file all at once.

      • log

        private static void log(java.util.logging.Level level,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.Throwable t)
        Generic log function that writes arbitrary text to the log file.
        Parameters:
        level - The level of this log message.
        message - The message to log.
        t - Error or exception to log with the message. Can be null if there is no error or exception to log.

      • info

        public static void info(java.lang.String message)
        Log an informative message to the log file.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.

        public static void error(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Log an error or exception with the default message.
        Parameters:
        t - The error or exception to display.

      • error

        public static void error(java.lang.String message,
                         java.lang.Throwable t)
        Log an error message, and include the name and stack trace of the associated exception or error.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        t - The error or exception to display with the message.

      • addToLogBuffer

        private static void addToLogBuffer(java.lang.String text)
        Add arbitrary text to the log buffer, replacing newlines with the newline replacement string.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to add to the buffer.

      • writeToLogFile

        private static void writeToLogFile(java.lang.String text)
        Write arbitrary text to the log file.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to write.

      • echo

        private static void echo(java.lang.String text)
        Write arbitrary text to the output stream specified for this logger, as long as the stream is non-null and echo is enabled.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to write.

      • setEchoEnabled

        public static void setEchoEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable echo, which will write log entries to the currently specified output stream in addition to the log file.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Enable/disable echo.

      • setOutputStream

        public static void setOutputStream(java.io.PrintStream stream)
        Set the output stream to which log messages will be written in addition to the log file.

        When calling any of the logging methods, the log entry will be both printed to the output stream and written to the log file. You can also set this to null to disable printing to the output stream. The log file will still be written to, however.

        Parameters:
        stream - The output stream to write to.

      • setLogFileName

        public static void setLogFileName(java.lang.String name)
        Set a new name for the log file to which log entries will be written.

        Log service must be restarted for changes to take effect. (Ex: "log.txt")

        Parameters:
        name - New name for the log file

      • setLogWriteInterval

        public static void setLogWriteInterval(int interval)
        Set how often queued log messages will be written to the log file.
        Parameters:
        interval - The delay in milliseconds between writes.

      • constructFileWriter

        private static void constructFileWriter()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reconstruct the file writer with the current log file name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while constructing the file writer.

      • getStackTrace

        public static java.lang.String getStackTrace(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Get a log-friendly formatted stack trace from an error or exception.
        Parameters:
        t - The error or exception to get the stack trace of.
        Returns:
        a log-friendly stack trace.
